page.title: 05The cockles of Penclawdd.
page.content: One of our local industries in this area is the collection of cockles.They are collected on Llanrhidian and Wernffrwd sands on the North coast of the Gower peninsula. Most of the collectors are women,they must be very wary of the incoming tide.They also collect seaweed and mussles to make a traditional Welsh dish of larva bread. After they collect the cockles,mussles and seaweed,they have to take them to the factory to be washed and cleaned, ready to be sold at the market in Swansea. The cockle women also go around our area selling cockles from their vans,a small bag costs 40p,a wine glass full costs around 35p. The cockle women enjoy their work very much,they are a good example of a traditional industry in the area.
